doc.after: According to the Constitution the country comprises eighty five federal subjects 141 including the Republic of Crimea and the federal city of Sevastopol whose recent establishment is internationally disputed and criticized as illegal annexation 142 In 1993 when the Constitution was adopted there were eighty nine federal subjects listed but later some of them were merged These subjects have equal representation two delegates each in the Federation Council 143 However they differ in the degree of autonomy they enjoy
